TrainRandomForestRegressorPiece.name: TrainRandomForestRegressorPiece
TrainRandomForestRegressorPiece.description: Train Random Forest Regressor over the input data

train_data_path.description: The path to the train data to train the data.
train_data_path.title: Train Data Path

n_estimators.description: The number of trees in the forest.
n_estimators.title: Number of Estimators

criterion.description: The function to measure the quality of a split.
criterion.title: Criterion

max_depth.description: The maximum depth of the tree.
max_depth.title: Max Depth

bootstrap.description: Whether bootstrap samples are used when building trees.If False, the whole dataset is used to build each tree.
bootstrap.title: Bootstrap

oob_score.description: Whether to use out-of-bag samples to estimate the generalization score.By default, r2_score is used.Provide a callable with signature metric(y_true, y_pred) to use a custom metric.Only available if bootstrap=True.
oob_score.title: Oob Score

n_jobs.description: The number of jobs to run in parallel. fit, predict, decision_path and apply are all parallelized over the trees. -1 means using all processors.
n_jobs.title: Number of jobs in parallel

random_state.description: Controls both the randomness of the bootstrapping of the samples used when building trees (if bootstrap=True) and the sampling of the features to consider when looking for the best split at each node (if max_features < n_features)
random_state.title: Random state

max_samples.description: If bootstrap is True, the number of samples to draw from X to train each base estimator.
max_samples.title: Max samples

target_column.description: The name of the target column.
target_column.title: Target column

random_forest_model_path.description: The path to the random forest regressor
random_forest_model_path.title: Random Forest Model Path
